RES. Collection.questionText: Regarding the lateral wall of the nose, which is TRUE?
options: The middle meatus contains the hiatus semilunaris
The sphenoidal air sinus opens into the middle meatus
Posterior ethmoidal air sinus opens at the inferior meatus

RES. Collection.questionText: Regarding the phrenic nerves, which statement is TRUE?
options: Each phrenic nerve begins in the thorax
The left phrenic nerve pierces the central tendon of the diaphragm
It arises from C3, C4 and C5 spinal roots
The right phrenic supplies motor fibers to the esophagus

RES. Collection.questionText: Regarding the trachea, which statement is FALSE?
options: It descends in the superior mediastinum
It begins at the level of C6

RES. Collection.questionText: The pleural cavity is the space between the:
All muscles of the larynx are supplied by the recurrent laryngeal nerve EXCEPT:
The superior mediastinum contains all of the following EXCEPT:
Which one of the following muscles can relax the vocal cords?
The mediastinal surface of the left lung is related to the following structures EXCEPT:
Which of the following about the surface anatomy of the pleura is FALSE?
options: The posterior border has the same surface anatomy on right and left sides
The left pleura deviates to the left at the 4th costal cartilage
The cervical pleura has similar surface anatomy on both sides
Both pleurae cross the 10th rib at the midclavicular line

The trachea ends at the level of:

The trachea is kept patent by:
The right main bronchus forms an angle of approximately:
Which of the following statements about the bronchi is FALSE?
options: Right bronchus is shorter and wider.
Right bronchus divides into 2 lobar bronchi.
Left bronchus divides into 2 lobar bronchi.

RES. Collection 2.questionText: The superior lobar bronchus of the right lung arises:
Landmarks of the trachea are:
The trachea:
options: Bifurcates at a variable level according to respiration
Is supplied by the superior thyroid arteries
Is non elastic and is supported by cartilaginous rings
Is in contact with the recurrent laryngeal nerve on the right

RES. Collection 2.questionText: The apex of the lung projects above the clavicle by:
The anterior border of the left lung deviates at which costal cartilage to form the cardiac notch?
The inferior border of the lung crosses the 8th rib in the:

The horizontal fissure is present in which lung?

How many bronchopulmonary segments are found in the left lung?

The left upper lobe contains which unique segments?

Which of the following is NOT a branch of typical intercostal nerves?

A patient with a pleural effusion is to undergo aspiration of fluid from the pleural space. From superficial to deep, identify the correct order of structures the needle must pass before it enters the pleural cavity:
options: External intercostals - innermost intercostals - internal intercostals - parietal pleura
External intercostals - internal intercostals - parietal pleura - innermost intercostals
Parietal pleura - innermost intercostals - internal intercostals - external intercostals
External intercostals - internal intercostals - innermost intercostals - parietal pleura

RES. Collection 2.questionText: With regard to intercostal spaces:
options: The neurovascular bundle runs in plane between external intercostal and internal intercostal muscles
The upper two spaces are supplied by the supreme intercostal artery
The collateral branches of the intercostal artery and nerve run along the upper border of the rib
The collateral branch of the intercostal nerve supplies skin over the space

RES. Collection 2.questionText: With regard to the thoracic wall:
options: The intercostal vessels and nerves run between the external and internal intercostal muscles
Both the manubriosternal and xiphisternal joints are synovial with discs
The upper ribs have 'pump-handle' movement not 'bucket handle' movement

RES. Collection 2.questionText: The diaphragm has how many main areas of origin?
The central tendon of the diaphragm is:
The median lobe of the central tendon is related to the:
Motor innervation of the diaphragm is by:
Sensory innervation of the peripheral part of the diaphragm is from:
All of the following provide sensory innervation to the diaphragm EXCEPT:
Regarding the diaphragm:
options: The aorta is transmitted through an opening in the left crus
The left dome may ascend to the 5th intercostal space
The phrenic nerve branches run medially on its thoracic surface
It receives its blood supply entirely from lower intercostal and subcostal arteries

RES. Collection 2.questionText: Which of the following do not penetrate the diaphragm:

options: The right phrenic nerve lies anterior to the right lung root
It divides into anterior posterior and medial divisions on the abdominal surface of the diaphragm
